Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: custom seeds are possible through the restore option - https://support.komodoplatform.com/support/solutions/articles/29000030395-how-to-restore-wallet-from-your-seed-using-atomicdex-mobile

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@gigamesh this seed phrase will be valid in the other Komodo ecosystem wallets like: Verus Agama, Verus mobile, hyperDEX, chainswap etc.,
the same seed phrase may not produce the same address+privkey in other wallets

the best way to have access to your address from any wallet: cli, komodo ecosystem wallets, outside wallets is to backup the wif
wif - a string of characters that start with "U" for Komodo

you can convert a seed to wif in the Verus Agama wallet or the Komodo Ocean QT wallet
Verus Agama:<https://support.komodoplatform.com/support/solutions/articles/29000024495-export-private-key-wif-from-a-wallet-seed-or-pin-password>
Ocean QT: <https://support.komodoplatform.com/support/solutions/articles/29000030461-convert-your-seed-phrase-from-agama-into-a-private-key->

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: currently there is no way to login to atomicDEX/export with a wif, but it will come

Author: gigamesh#3544
Content: so in short the answer is no not now, but soon. thanks for the detailed reply

Author: ca333#0118
Content: @TonyLipsey thanks for the info - please contact polo and ask them to resolve this. I will look into the wallet now and check if we can just provide t1 address in there. But as stated above - the addresses are valid, just diff. format: https://explorer.zcha.in/accounts/t1V3CMUxXJHWupN1QvQmk4bS1QvzBAjyUjb - micro test transaction is now visible.

Author: TonyLipsey#3998
Content: Thank you!

Author: ca333#0118
Content: @TonyLipsey we will update the wallet so it has the expected format with the `t1` prefix - although its already "valid" it likely won't be accepted by most TX engines as these validate an address differently. AtomicDEX decodes the address and manages to send the coins even if an ordinary address validator would return `false` (= invalid). Sorry for the inconvenience. Our internal tests didn't catch this one as the differently formatted address is technically/mathematically valid. I will let you know when the new version is out.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: Until then, if anyone wants to withdraw to atomicDEX just put your address in explorer to see the matching `t` address
